Legal_Issue: Whether the applicant meets the residency requirement under section 5(1)(c) of the Citizenship Act
Procedural_Context: Appeal by Minister of Citizenship and Immigration
Evidence_Type: Duration of physical presence, family ties, vacation patterns, employment abroad
Basis_of_Claim: Failure to meet physical residency requirement
Evaluation_Standard: One day counted for each day present in Canada after becoming a permanent resident
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Prolonged absence due to overseas employment, failure of 'centralized mode of existence' test
Application_Error: Misrepresentation of residency or misunderstanding of residency obligation
Assessment_Standard: Objective assessment of physical presence and residential ties
Legal_Standard: Three out of four years physical residency requirement
Application_Factor: Applicant spent only 22 days in Canada pre-application
Decision_Review_Issue: Correctness of interpretation of residency requirement
Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness or correctness, depending on legal interpretation
Cause_of_Refusal: Prolonged absence from Canada due to overseas employment despite family residing in Canada
Evidentiary_Issues: Reliance on non-residential connections such as family and vacations despite minimal physical presence
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Claim of maintaining central life in Canada through family and visits
Procedural_Issue: Minister’s right to appeal citizenship judge’s decision
Omission_Type: Failure to disclose or appreciate residency obligations
